name: allegheny-county-building-footprint-locations-a9b48
notes:
This dataset contains photogrammetrically compiled roof outlines ofnbuildings.u00a0 All near orthogonal cornersnare square.u00a0 Buildings that are less thann400 square feet are not captured.u00a0nSpecial consideration is given to garages that are less than 400 squarenfeet and will be digitized when greater than 200 square feet.u00a0 Interim rooflines, such as dormers and partynwalls, as well as minor structures, such as carports, decks, patios, stairs,netc., and impermanent structures, such as sheds, are not shown. Large buildingsnwhich appear to house activities that are commercial or industrial in naturenare shown as commercial/industrial. Structures that appear to be primarilynresidential in nature, including hotels and apartment buildings are shown asnresidential buildings. Structures which appear to be used or owned primarily byngovernmental, nonprofit, religious, or charitable organizations, or which servena public function are shown as public buildings. Structures which are closelynassociated with a larger building, such as a garage, are shown as an outnbuilding. Structures which cannot be clearly defined as Industrial/Commercial;nResidential; Public; or Out Buildings are flagged as such for laterncategorization. The classification of buildings is subject to theninterpretation from the aerial photography and may not reflect the buildingu2019snactual use.u00a0 Buildings that have an areanless than the minimum required size for data capture will occasionally benpresent in the Geodatabase.u00a0 Buildingsnare not removed after they have been digitized and determined to be less thannthe minimum required size.nn

If viewing this description on the Western PennsylvanianRegional Data Centeru2019s open data portal (
>http://www.wprdc.org), thisndataset is harvested on a weekly basis from Allegheny Countyu2019s GIS data portaln(

>http://openac.alcogis.opendata.arcgis.com/). Thenfull metadata record for this dataset can also be found on Allegheny Countyu2019snGIS portal. You can access the metadata record and other resources on the GISnportal by clicking on the u201cExploreu201d button (and choosing the u201cGo to resourceu201dnoption) to the right of the u201cArcGIS Open Datasetu201d text below.

Development Notes:u00a0 Data meets or exceeds map accuracy standardsnin effect during the spring of 1992 and updated as a result of a flyover in thenspring of 2004 and 2015. Original data was derived from aerial photography flown in thenspring of 1992 for the eastern half of the County and the spring of 1993 fornthe western half of the County.u00a0 Photographynwas produced at a scale of 1"=1500'. Mapping was stereo digitized at anscale of 1"=200'.

extras.value: Allegheny County / City of Pittsburgh / Western PA Regional Data Center

organization.description: Allegheny County (Pennsylvania) and the City of Pittsburgh both publish their data through the Western Pennsylvania Regional Data Center. The Western Pennsylvania Regional Data Center supports key community initiatives by making public information easier to find and use. The Data Center maintains Allegheny County and the City of Pittsburghu2019s open data portal, and provides a number of services to data publishers and users. The Data Center also hosts datasets from these and other public sector agencies, academic institutions, and non-profit organizations. The Data Center is managed by the University of Pittsburghu2019s Center for Social and Urban Research, and is a partnership of the University, Allegheny County and the City of Pittsburgh.
